variants.name: tune
variants.description: Tune libint for use with the given package

variants.name: fma
variants.description: Generate code utilizing FMA (requires capable CPU and recent enough compiler)

description:
Libint is a high-performance library for computing Gaussian integrals in
quantum mechanics.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: gmp
dependencies.description:
GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on
signed integers, rational numbers, and floating-point numbers.

dependent_to.name: votca-xtp
dependent_to.description:
Versatile Object-oriented Toolkit for Coarse-graining Applications
(VOTCA) is a package intended to reduce the amount of routine work when
doing systematic coarse-graining of various systems. The core is written
in C++. This package contains the VOTCA exciton transport engine.

dependent_to.name: cp2k
dependent_to.description:
CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid,
molecular, periodic, material, crystal, and biological systems

dependent_to.name: votca
dependent_to.description:
VOTCA is a software package which focuses on the analysis of molecular
dynamics data, the development of systematic coarse-graining techniques
as well as methods used for simulating microscopic charge (and exciton)
transport in disordered semiconductors.
